name: df-rlreg
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2
body: |- wceq(crlreg, cmpt(s0, universe, crab(s1, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), wral(s2, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), wi(wceq(co(cv(s1), cfv(cmulr, cv(s0)), cv(s2)), cfv(c0g, cv(s0))), wceq(cv(s2), cfv(c0g, cv(s0))))))))
bodyPretty: ‚ä¢ RLReg =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶ { s1 ‚àà(Base ` s0)| ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà(Base ` s0),((s1[(√ó ` s0)]s2)=(0 ` s0)‚Üí s2 =(0 ` s0)))})
comment: Define the set of _left-regular elements_ in a ring as those elements which are not left zero divisors, meaning that multiplying a nonzero element on the left by a left-regular element gives a nonzero product. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 22-Mar-2015.)
